climbs.name: Why is my Kneepad in the Tree?
climbs.fa: Bob Cable, Pat Brennan and Julia Cronk, October 2001

content.description: Climb a ramp to chimney system to a ledge and the base of the summit block. Climb a hand crack then jog left and finish in a finger crack to anchors on the summit.
content.location:
Center of the south face and right of

Wedding Cake Special

.

climbs.name: Wedding Cake Special
climbs.fa: Pat Brennan, Bob Cable and Julia Cronk, October 2001

content.description: Climb the slightly right-leaning wide crack which gets easier higher as turns to a hand crack in a left-facing corner.
content.location: Obvious crack on the left side of the face.

climbs.name: Wahalota is in my Face
climbs.fa: Bob Cable, Pat Brennan and Julia Cronk, October 2001

content.description:
Start up a ramp shared with

Why is my Kneepad in the Tree?

and where that route continues straight move left up the face to a ledge. Continue up the face above passing several horizontal cracks and finish with a thin crack in a right-facing corner.
content.location:
Center of the south face and shares the start with

Why is my Kneepad in the Tree?

.

climbs.name: Chair Dancin'
climbs.fa: Pat Brennan, Bob Cable and Julia Cronk, October 2001

content.description:
A hand crack leads to disjointed cracks with face climbing higher.

Pat is legendary for his chair dancing.
content.location:
Right side of the formation and right of

Why is my Kneepad in the Tree?

.
